content: Select next item to the right

comment.text: This translation key is used for "Select next item to the right", appearing as a button label on a hotkeys panel in the UI. It indicates the action of moving to the next element from the left when a specific hotkey is pressed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'Select next item to the right' implies selecting the item to the *right* of the current selection. The Armenian translation 'Ընտրեք հաջորդ միավորը ձախ կողմում' translates to 'Select the next item on the *left* side'. This is the opposite of the intended meaning.

The Japanese translation includes "(右)" which, while indicating 'right,' might be redundant or less natural depending on the UI context.  It's generally better to let the visual arrangement imply direction.

The translation "ເລືອກລາຍການຕໍ່ໄປໄປທາງຂວາ" is a literal translation but doesn't convey the meaning of selecting the *next* item, particularly in a UI context. It translates to "select next item to the right". While not entirely wrong, it's not the most natural or concise way to express the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເລືອກລາຍການຕໍ່ໄປ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Выделить следующий объект справа' doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'Select next item to the right'. 'Выделить' (to highlight/select) is accurate, but 'объект' (object) is too generic. 'Item' refers to a specific element within a list or group, not just any object.

The English phrase 'Select next item to the right' implies selecting the item *immediately* to the right. The Sinhala translation 'දකුණු පස ඊළඟ අථකය තෝරන්න' (dakunu pasa eelaga athakaya thoranna) is more general and could mean 'the next item on the right' which isn't necessarily the one directly to the right. It lacks the specificity of 'next/immediate'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more precise translation like 'දකුණු පස වූ ඊළඟ අථකය තෝරන්න' (dakunu pasa vu eelaga athakaya thoranna) which emphasizes the immediate right.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'අථකය' (athakaya) might be a typo. It's likely intended to be 'අයිතමය' (aithamaya) which means 'item' in a more generic sense, suitable for a UI element.
The translation 'Izberi naslednji predmet desno' is a literal translation, but 'item' doesn't quite capture the intended meaning of a selectable option within a hotkey panel. It's too general.
While 'desno' is correct, it could be slightly improved for readability in this context.

The translation "Одабери следећу ставку са десне стране" is a literal translation but doesn't quite capture the meaning of "Select next item to the right" in a user interface context. It sounds slightly formal and cumbersome. A more natural and common way to express this would be related to navigating a list or selection.

The translation 'Odaberi sledeću stavku sa desne strane' is not the most natural or accurate translation of "Select next item to the right". 'Stavku' refers to a paragraph or clause, not an item in a list or panel. The phrase 'sa desne strane' is grammatically correct but wordy. A more natural translation would focus on the action of selecting the next item.
The translated text is a full sentence, whereas in UI elements, shorter phrases are often preferred for brevity. While grammatically correct, it might be too long for some UI elements.
The translation 'Sıradaki öğeyi sağa doğru seç' is a literal translation but sounds slightly awkward in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be 'Sağdaki öğeyi seç'.
